Description: Body fragment of large North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; unevenly fired; cream slip; exterior: lotus bud and and unusual void ray motif, in two registers; interior: antithetic griffin (front of face and body only) and swan; filling ornaments: blobs and rosettes; added red patches on eye, tip of tail and breast of swan, breast and beak of griffin, and alternate petals of rosettes; horizontal black bands with added white (and red?) lines above and below figured frieze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.771)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
